lexUnit.name: crumple.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: crush or become crushed so as to become creased and wrinkled

sentence.text: After he had read it aloud he crumpled the note up in his fist and thrust it into the fire as if the very sight of it was hateful .
Ymor crumpled the note and tossed it into a corner .
She bit her lip , crumpling the note in her hand , and into her eyes came a look so desolate that Taggy 's heart contracted .
He crumples the paper , pretends to put it in his mouth , then billows his cheeks until he regurgitates tiny pieces all over his chest .
A year or so later , or it may have been an hour , I crumpled up four sheets of paper and threw them to the floor , and started another , and I was there .
She crumpled the sheets of paper and tossed them on the coffee-table .
He stared out to sea , crumpling the chocolate wrapper slowly in his hand .
Vologsky seized the form , crumpling it into a ball in his palm .
Corbett crumpled the parchment into a ball and threw it angrily at the wall .
The Princesse crumpled the telegram into a tight ball .
After a few seconds , he crumpled the aluminium with a sudden grip of his fist , as though he had taken an important decision .
Feeling much refreshed , she crumpled the tissues with the empty packet into a tight ball and tossed the lot into the waste basket .
Crumpling the envelope in her hand , she tossed it into the fire , watching intently while it blackened and burned before returning to the single sheet of cheap paper .
Jimmy laughed as loudly as the others , but he did n't like the way they were crumpling his comics .
She picked one up , stood there swaying in her newly learnt balance , and crumpled the leaf .
Gabriel suddenly slapped the fist of his hand down on the pile of paper and crumpled the topmost sheet .

All kinds of things can be used as reflectors : projection screens ; aluminium foil which has been crumpled , roughly straightened out and stuck onto a sheet of hardboard ; or purpose-made reflectors bought from photographic dealers .
At last he sat back , tousled and infuriated , crumpled the cheque and hurled it across the room .
Bodie took the sheet from him and crumpled it up .
Alice crumpled it up and pushed it into the kitchen bin .
Doug tore the page out , crumpled it and threw it in the waste-paper basket before starting again .
I crumpled this ticket and waited for the next to be called .
Henry looked at himself in the kitchen mirror , as he crumpled up the other three pages of this latest missive and threw it in the swingbin .
